contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Prime Minister | name = Vasile Petru Tarlev | image = | order = [[Prime Minister of Moldova]] | term_start = 19 April 2001 | term_end = 31 March 2008 | president = [[Vladimir Voronin]] | deputy = [[Vasilie Iovv]] <br /> [[Zinaida Greceanîi]] | predecessor = [[Dumitru Braghiş]] | successor = [[Zinaida Greceanîi]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1963|10|06|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Başcalia]], <small>[[Basarabeasca district]], [[Moldovan SSR]]</small> | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Party of Communists of the Republic of Moldova|Party of Communists]] | spouse = | religion = [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Eastern Orthodoxy]] | nicknames = }} '''Vasile Petru Tarlev''' ({{lang-bg|Васил Петров Тарлев}}; {{lang-ru|Василий Павлович Тарлев}}) (born October 6, 1963) is a [[Moldova]]n politician, and was [[Prime Minister of Moldova]] from 2001 until 2008. == Biography == He studied engineering and became a member of assorted economic councils. He was appointed Prime Minister on April 19, 2001. Tarlev is ethnically a [[Bessarabian Bulgarian]] and was born in [[Başcalia]], [[Basarabeasca district]]. He resigned on March 19, 2008 in an unexpected move, saying that he wanted to make way for "new people." Parliament approved his resignation on March 20, and President [[Vladimir Voronin]] proposed [[Zinaida Greceanîi]] as his successor;<ref>[http://www.itar-tass.com/eng/level2.html?NewsID=12501114&PageNum=0 "Moldova’s Voronin submits PM candidacy to parliament"], ITAR-TASS, March 21, 2008.</ref> she was approved by [[Moldovan Parliament]] on 31 March 2008.<ref>[http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/03/31/europe/EU-POL-Moldova-New-Government.php "Moldova's Parliament approves new government"], Associated Press (''International Herald Tribune''), March 31, 2008.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Wikinewshas|related<br>[[wikinews:Moldova's Prime Minister Vasile Tarlev resigns|Vasile Tarlev resigns]]}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{Succession box | title = [[Prime Minister of Moldova]] | before = [[Dumitru Braghiş]] | after = [[Zinaida Greceanîi]] | years = 2001—2008 }} {{s-end}} {{Prime Ministers of Moldova}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Tarlev, Vasile | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Prime Minister of Moldova | DATE OF BIRTH =October 6, 1963 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Başcalia]], [[Basarabeasca district]], [[Moldovan SSR]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tarlev, Vasile}} [[Category:Moldovan communists]] [[Category:Moldovan politicians]] [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:People from Basarabeasca District]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Moldova]] [[Category:Bessarabian Bulgarians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Republic (Moldova)]] {{Moldova-politician-stub}}
